captions.text:
00:17
COMM: A 
time machine… in a traffic jam. Not something

you see everyday unless you live near Ollie
Wilkey. But while his car might not actually

be able to travel through time. It's owner
believes it's pride and joy is the most screen

accurate 'Back to the Future' Delorean in
Britain.

00:34
COMM: A lifelong fan of the films, Ollie knew

from a young age that he wanted a car just
like Marty McFly's,

00:40
OLLIE: I saw it when I was about 10 and I

thought I bet when I learn to drive I can
get a Delorean. It was about sixty-five hundred

left. If you can get a good running one, very
good investment.

00:51
COMM: At age 26 he was able to buy and renovate
an original Delorean, which he still owns.

00:57
OLLIE: The first Delorean I bought in pieces

as a restoration. I was able to pay for the
parts over the 2 years we did it up. It was

a long process and it was essentially my savings
fund.

01:08
COMM: but then a couple of years later, his

time travel dreams came true when he had the
chance to buy the sci-fi work of art.

01:16
OLLIE: I bought the car through the Delorean's

owners club. I met a guy from there who bought
the car and imported it from America. The

real life Doc Brown as it were, is an ex-NASA
electrical engineer based in Florida. He now

converts Delorean's into back to the future
replica time machines.

01:33
COMM: The attention to detail is every fans

dream. Including iconic props like flux capacitor
and Mr Fusion.

01:43
OLLIE: My favourite part of the car is the

time circuits where you can input your destination
time. When you hit 88 miles an hour it will

activate time travel mode. It would look and
act as if it made a jump through time. The

most iconic parts of the car is it's gull-wing
doors. When you open the doors it makes a

futuristic opening noise as it does in the
film.

02:09
COMM: To complete the experience Ollie has

managed to acquire a host of replica props
from the film.

02:15
OLLIE: People do love a Nike shoes. They love

the hoverboard. People get just as excited
about the hoverboard as they do about the
whole car.

02:22
COMM: While the car isn't exactly practical

for going down the shops, it does attract
plenty of attention.

02:27
OLLIE: I've had people right up behind me

taking a video. You always get a bit worried
because it's not so much your driving but

someone going back of you. Luckily I've never
been pulled over and whenever I do see police

they usually just give you a thumbs up and
a smile.

02:40
COMM: Entrepreneur Ollie has even managed

to turn his boyhood dream into a business.
Hiring out the car for weddings and other

events. But what does his girlfriend Anna
think?

02:51
ANNA: First I was a bit like, yep okay it's

another Delorean and then I got inside it
and then I got really excited as well and

I was a bit like a little kid pressing on
the buttons and it does this, it does that.

I've always liked the films but I won't necessarily
call myself a fan as in I'd want to get one.

I'd rather get a VolksWagen camper van, so
I'd happily get the ones the Libyan's come

in. That would be the next thing, I would
like that thank you very much, Instead of
having two Deloreans.

03:16
COMM: What does the future hold for Ollie
and his Delorean's, only time will tell.

title: Great Scott! Man Owns Real Life Back To The Future DeLorean
